info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-environment-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for monitoring Environment of a Network Element.
     Copyright (c) 2016-2019, 2023, 2024 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Platform & Hardware
**Paths:** 6

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-environment-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-environment-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-environment-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-environment-oper.html)

get.description:
A set of metrics monitoring environmental sensor activity and alarm severity levels, including
         the number of active alarms at different severity, as well as active, and cancelled sensors
The list of components on the device chassis (collection)
The list of components on the device chassis
The list of components on the device chassis (collection)
The list of components on the device chassis

state.description: A description of the current state of the sensor

current-reading.description: Numerical value of the current sensor reading in sensor-units

sensor-units.description: Units corresponding to the current-reading value

low-critical-threshold.description:
Alarm threshold under which a critical
         alarm will be signalled

high-critical-threshold.description:
Alarm threshold over which a critical
         alarm will be signalled

hi-minor-thrsld.description:
The threshold value above which a minor alarm is triggered,
         indicating a potential issue that requires attention but is not critical.

hi-major-thrsld.description:
The threshold value above which a major alarm is triggered,
         indicating issue that requires immediate attention.

name.description:
Name of the sensor component.
         This includes all physical components of the chassis -
         both fixed and pluggable

crit-alrm.description:
The threshold value that triggers a critical alarm,
         indicating a severe issue that requires immediate attention.

minor-alrm.description:
The threshold value that triggers a minor alarm,
         indicating a potential issue that should be monitored.

major-alrm.description:
The threshold value that triggers a major alarm,
         indicating a serious issue that needs prompt resolution.

cancl-snsrs.description:
The number of sensors that have been cancelled or are no longer active,
         indicating sensors that have been disabled or removed.

null-st-snsrs.description:
The number of sensors with undefined or empty sensor states,
         representing sensors that are uninitialized or unable to report valid data.

null-st-snsrs.description:
The number of sensors with undefined or empty sensor states,
         representing sensors that are uninitialized or unable to report valid data.

env-stat.description:
A set of metrics monitoring environmental sensor activity and alarm severity levels, including
         the number of active alarms at different severity, as well as active, and cancelled sensors
